docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs
docs.text:
Under Construction

As of now the library still has some dust, we are currently working on adding more, but it's still a work in progress

For full documentation visit mkdocs.org.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Code example
docs.text:
An example of python code:

# Function to add two numbers
def add_two_numbers(num1, num2):
    return num1 + num2

# Example usage
result = add_two_numbers(5, 3)
print('The sum is:', result)

docs.title: Kubernetes Objects
docs.text:
In Kuberenetes, objects are organized in a hierarchal structure, similar to a Russian nesting doll.

+---Cluster
|   +---Node
|   |   +---Pods
|   |   |   +---Containers

Containers are the smallest object in the structure, representing a program running on a virtual or physical machine.

The objects in Kubernetes are most easily defined using definition YAML files.

Pods/NodesReplicaSetsDeployments

This is where the containers that run appications live. Conventionally, Pods contain a single application container, so scaling an application occurs by creating more Pods, not creating more containers inside of a single Pod. The Pod is referred to as 'the atom' of Kubernetes

There are several general use command line commands when it comes to pods including:

  • kubectl get pods to return a list of the created Pods and their states (RUNNING, etc.)
  • kubectl get pods -o wide similar to the command above but with more information including the Pod's node and internal IP address
  • kubectl describe pod name to get a detailed description of the Pod named name

docs.title: Gain LLM and Generative AI Comfort
docs.text:
These tools are not going away any time soon, and the need to add the ability to manage and use them to the resume is becoming paramount.

To help this comfortablility, a dashboard should be developed in Node.js using React components. This project will be guided an scaffolded by Claude and be used to visualize various recovery statistics throughout the year.

docs.title: Kubernetes Knowledge
docs.text:
This year, an interest to expand on for the resume is to learn more containerization, specifically Kubernetes and its tech stack. To do this I will complete the Udemy course:

  • Kubernetes Certified Application Developer (CKAD) with Tests

Following this course completion, the Certified Kubernetes Application Developer (CKAD) exam will be passed for certification.

docs.title: .NET Language and Structure
docs.text:
It seems that over the coming year it will be imperative to gain proficiency in both .NET programming languages (C#, F#, etc.) and the build structure for work. This will require conistent outside typical work hours work to maintain standards, so time needs to be set aside to iterate on these skills with side projects and other various ways to stay up to date.

A fun way to do this would be to continue to iterate on game ideas within the MonoGame engine, which uses pure .NET

docs.title: Continue to Work on Side Projects
docs.text:
By the end of 2026 the:

  • resume site will be feature complete with only new experiences being added
  • NBA stat application will have a working UI and fully developed backend
  • Arbitrage dashboard with Drew will be in a usable condition for at least two prediction markets.

docs.title: Figure Out a Sustainable Budget for Current Situation
docs.text:
Rocket Money budget is out of date. Update all of the categories and start to refine more specific portions to identify problem areas in the first 2 months of the year to get a handle of it

  • Decide if current BettorOdds subscription is worthwhile
  • Focus on cooking more food and less out to eat
    • Outside of dates and lunches with Nana, only one out to eat a week if sitdown/two if fast food

docs.title: Continue to Contribute to Retirement Accounts
docs.text:
Josh is a fantastic resource to bounce ideas off of in addition to managing the retirement accounts, use that resource.

Contributions this year:

  • Get to $10k contributed to Rockefeller accounts
    • $7.5k commited to Roth IRA
    • $230 per month from February to December gets to this goal
  • Continue to contribute 10% of gross pay to 401k
  • Continue to invest money over $1k in HSA

Re-Evalute position in April after merit increases go through at work

docs.title: Doctor's Visits
docs.text: A primary care doctor is something that needs to be found this year. Kate's situation shows that datapoints on your health are important, primary care provider would be important this year.

docs.title: Fitness
docs.text: The name of the game this year is hypertrophy and strength. To do this workout cycles will be broken down into 8 week cycles, with the goal of 5 days in the gym and two recovery days. In the summer those recovery days will include a walk outside on the trails, and gym will go to 4 days a week to account for sprinting intervals on what would have been the 5th gym day.

docs.title: Recovery
docs.text:
The goal this year is to create a managable schedule for sleep and maximize recovery as it relates to fitness. To achieve this, sleep needs to become more dialed in. No staying awake until almost 4 am anymore, the body just doesn't recover well enough anymore.

The goal is to average 21 green recovery days a month, with an additional 5 days of above 50% yellow recovery. This will allow for some days of poor recovery, but still allow for alcohol consumption and some days of little rest
